metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Let's learn some basic XQuery by looking at an example.
content.html: Let's learn some basic XQuery by looking at an example.

content.text: We will use the following XML document in the examples below.
content.html: We will use the following XML document in the examples below.

content.code:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>


<bookstore>


<book category="COOKING">


<title lang="en">Everyday Italian</title>


<author>Giada De Laurentiis</author>


<year>2005</year>


<price>30.00</price>

</book>


<book category="CHILDREN">


<title lang="en">Harry Potter</title>


<author>J K. Rowling</author>


<year>2005</year>


<price>29.99</price>

</book>


<book category="WEB">


<title lang="en">XQuery Kick Start</title>


<author>James McGovern</author>


<author>Per Bothner</author>


<author>Kurt Cagle</author>


<author>James Linn</author>


<author>Vaidyanathan Nagarajan</author>


<year>2003</year>


<price>49.99</price>

</book>


<book category="WEB">


<title lang="en">Learning XML</title>


<author>Erik T. Ray</author>


<year>2003</year>


<price>39.95</price>

</book>


</bookstore>
content.code_html:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<bookstore>

<book category="COOKING">
  <title lang="en">Everyday Italian</title>
  <author>Giada De Laurentiis</author>
  <year>2005</year>
  <price>30.00</price>
</book>

<book category="CHILDREN">
  <title lang="en">Harry Potter</title>
  <author>J K. Rowling</author>
  <year>2005</year>
  <price>29.99</price>
</book>

<book category="WEB">
  <title lang="en">XQuery Kick Start</title>
  <author>James McGovern</author>
  <author>Per Bothner</author>
  <author>Kurt Cagle</author>
  <author>James Linn</author>
  <author>Vaidyanathan Nagarajan</author>
  <year>2003</year>
  <price>49.99</price>
</book>

<book category="WEB">
  <title lang="en">Learning XML</title>
  <author>Erik T. Ray</author>
  <year>2003</year>
  <price>39.95</price>
</book>

</bookstore>

links.text: View the "books.xml" file in your browser

content.text: View the "books.xml" file in your browser .
content.html: View the "books.xml" file in your browser.

content.text: XQuery uses functions to extract data from XML documents.
content.html: XQuery uses functions to extract data from XML documents.

content.text: The doc() function is used to open the "books.xml" file:
content.html: The doc() function is used to open the "books.xml" file:

content.text: XQuery uses path expressions to navigate through elements in an XML document.
content.html: XQuery uses path expressions to navigate through elements in an XML document.

content.text: The following path expression is used to select all the title elements in the "books.xml" file:
content.html: The following path expression is used to select all the title elements in the "books.xml" file:

content.text: (/bookstore selects the bookstore element, /book selects all the book elements under the bookstore element, and /title selects all the title elements under each book element)
content.html: (/bookstore selects the bookstore element, /book selects all the book elements under the bookstore element, and /title selects all the title elements under each book element)

content.text: The XQuery above will extract the following:
content.html: The XQuery above will extract the following:

content.code:
<title lang="en">Everyday Italian</title>

<title lang="en">Harry Potter</title>

<title lang="en">XQuery Kick Start</title>

<title lang="en">Learning XML</title>
content.code_html:
<title lang="en">Everyday Italian</title>
<title lang="en">Harry Potter</title>
<title lang="en">XQuery Kick Start</title>
<title lang="en">Learning XML</title>

content.text: XQuery uses predicates to limit the extracted data from XML documents.
content.html: XQuery uses predicates to limit the extracted data from XML documents.

content.text: The following predicate is used to select all the book elements under the bookstore element that have a price element with a value that is less than 30:
content.html: The following predicate is used to select all the book elements under the bookstore element that have a price element with a value that is less than 30:

content.text: The XQuery above will extract the following:
content.html: The XQuery above will extract the following:

content.code_html:
<book category="CHILDREN">
  <title lang="en">Harry Potter</title>
  <author>J K. Rowling</author>
  <year>2005</year>
  <price>29.99</price>
</book>
